---
title: "Data Analysis"
output: html_document
---

```{r importing-data}
Summer_olympics <- read_csv("data/Summer-Olympic-medals-1976-to-2008.csv")
Country_codes <- read_csv("data/coutry-and-continent-codes.csv")
```

```{r augmenting-data}
#names(Country_codes)[names(Country_codes) == 'Three_Letter_Country_Code'] <- 'Country_code'
Olympics_complete<-Summer_Olympics %>%
  left_join(Country_codes, by="Country_code") %>%
  mutate(Medal_value = case_when(
    Medal == "Gold" ~ 3,
    Medal == "Silver"    ~ 2,
    Medal == "Bronze" ~ 1
    )) 
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
